comment._content: This series of photo pages on this album could possibly be a photographic dossier of all the unions and federations in Hong Kong that were or seen to be pro-Communist China and were under surveillance. During the 1950s, there was  a huge influx of mainland Chinese coming into Hk to escape Communism. The British colonial government was very good in taking them all in. Some of those who came to HK disguised themselves as refugees and were actually agitators who stirred up anti-colonial sentiments in HK. There were riots and lots of anti-British propaganda going on too during this time.
